Class Blackjack

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • Blackjack
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class Blackjack
extends java.awt.Container
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    (c) 2012 Bohde Productions Inc. All Rights Reserved. This class creates the main interface used to play the game. It contains the menus and code structure to manage the players money throughout the casino and dealing with switching games, creating games, and quitting games.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Blackjack

        public Blackjack()
        Sets up a Container which will be placed into the existing GameFrame as its content pane. Represents a Blackjack table.

    • Method Detail

      • addCard

        public void addCard(Card c)
        Convenience method for adding a card to the players ArrayList of cards and their side of the table.
        Parameters:
        c - the Card to be added

      • dAddCard

        public void dAddCard(Card c)
        Convenience method for adding a card to the dealers ArrayList of cards and their side of the table.
        Parameters:
        c - the Card to be added

      • getHandValue

        private int getHandValue(java.util.ArrayList<Card> list)
        Calculates the total value of a hand (passed in as a parameter) to calculate the round winner or determine the action for the dealer to take.
        Parameters:
        list - the ArrayList of cards representing a hand
        Returns:
        an integer value representing the total face value of all the cards in the hand

      • makeWager

        private void makeWager()
        Prompts the user to enter their bet in a dialog box. Input is taken as a String and parsed using Integer.parseInt(). If the input if not valid, an exception is thrown and caught and the user is prompted continously until appropriate input is provided. Invalid input includes text, a negative value, zero, or a value that is greater than the amount of money the user has.

      • showMsgDlg

        private void showMsgDlg(java.lang.String message,
              java.lang.String titleMessage,
              int type)
        Convenience method for displaying a JOptionPane message dialog.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be displayed in the dialog box
        titleMessage - the message to be displayed in the dialog's title bar
        type - the type of message being displayed; affects the icon which is shown in the dialog. It is preferable to use a field of JOptionPane.
        See Also:
        JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.WARNING_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.QUESTION_MESSAGE, JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE

      • isBust

        private boolean isBust(java.util.ArrayList<Card> list)
        Checks to see if a hand is bust (has a value of greater than 21).
        Parameters:
        list - the hand to check if bust
        Returns:
        true if the hand has a value of greater than 21, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        getHandValue(ArrayList list)

      • dealerTurn

        public void dealerTurn()
        Gameplay of the dealer. Implements standard soft 17 casino rules: hit under 16, stand on or above 17.
        See Also:
        dAddCard(Card), getHandValue(ArrayList), isBust(ArrayList)

      • end

        public void end()
        Determines the outcome of the hand and who won, and calls the appropriate method.
        See Also:
        lost(), victory(), push(), dealerBJ()

      • lost

        private void lost()
        Deals with player losing. Informs them in a dialog box, then kicks them out if they are bankrupt or prompts them to either play again or return to the main screen.

      • victory

        private void victory()
        Deals with player winning. Informs them in a dialog box, then kicks them out if they have bankrupt the casino or prompts them to either play again or return to the main screen.
        See Also:
        GameFrame.bankrupt()

      • push

        private void push()
        Deals with a push (tie). Informs them in a dialog box, then kicks them out if they have bankrupt the casino or prompts them to either play again or return to the main screen.
        See Also:
        GameFrame.bankrupt()

      • dealerBJ

        private void dealerBJ()
        Called when the dealer has blackjack. A dialog box is displayed informing the player. If the player is bankrupt, he is removed from the casino and the game is closed. The user is then prompted via a dialog box to either play another hand or quit, returning to the main screen.

      • resetBackground

        private void resetBackground()
        Resets original main screen. Used when user chooses to leave table between hands.
        See Also:
        GameFrame.cash, GameFrame.youHave, GameFrame.showMoney, GameFrame.BACKGROUND

        Handles actions processed on objects using this as their ActionListener

        Parameters:
